A decade has elapsed since the release of Stiff Little FingersÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ last LP, Guitar & Drum, but while fans await the arrival of their imminent PledgeMusic sponsored opus, this 5CD Original Album Series set offers a handy opportunity to revisit the enduring Belfast punksÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ legacy to date.
Stiff Little FingersÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ Rough Trade debut, Inflammable Material, showcases the band at their energised best. Including the incendiary Suspect Device and their bristling, Ulster-style reshaping of Bob MarleyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Johnny Was, this February Ã¢â‚¬â„¢79 release became the first independent LP to break the UK Top 20 album chart, and it remains one of punkÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s most iconic platters.
Jake Burns and the gang never quite matched it again. Featuring the angsty Top 20 hitÃ¢â‚¬Â¦
At the Edge, 1980Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s fiery, but more radio-friendly Chrysalis debut, NobodyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Heroes, came close, while Ã¢â‚¬â„¢81Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s underrated Go For It! successfully broadened the bandÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s palette, embracing punchy, brass-led pop (Silver Lining) and the heartfelt melancholia of Piccadilly Circus. Both are still vastly superior to 1980Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s water-treading live LP Hanx!, and Ã¢â‚¬â„¢82Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s mainstream pop-inclined Now ThenÃ¢â‚¬Â¦, though the latter does contain one of SLFÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s best 45s, the plaintive Bits of Kids.
